abstract: Toyota, Chrysler and Honda previously recalled the 2.1 million cars, but the fix administered was not effective, United States officials said.
snippet: Toyota, Chrysler and Honda previously recalled the 2.1 million cars, but the fix administered was not effective, United States officials said.
lead_paragraph: Toyota, Chrysler and Honda are recalling about 2.1 million vehicles with airbags that might suddenly deploy even when the vehicle is not in a crash after earlier recalls did not sufficiently address the problem. Federal regulators said replacement parts might not be fully available until the end of the year.

headline.main: Cars With Faulty Airbags Are Recalled Second Time, but Fix May Take a Year
headline.print_headline: Cars With Faulty Airbags Are Recalled Second Time, but Fix May Take a Year

byline.original: By Christopher Jensen and Danielle Ivory
